text:
He is a rising star in the international music industry.
And Troye Sivan enjoyed a huge career stepping stone on Thursday, when he performed on the Ellen DeGeneres Show.
Belting out his chart-topping song Youth with a live backing band, the 20-year-old certainly did Australia proud as he romanced the ears of the show's packed audience.
Scroll down for video
In the spotlight: Troye Sivan enjoyed a huge career stepping stone on Thursday when he performed on the Ellen DeGeneres Show
The young rocker was clad in a pair of denim jeans, a simple white T-shirt and a retro jacket, while completing his look with a pair of black shoes.
Straight after the performance, Troye tweeted to his more than three million followers: 'I still can't believe that actually happened' accompanied by a snap of himself holding a branded Ellen DeGeneres coffee mug.
Adding to his success, the rising star also donned the January front cover of Rolling Stones magazine.
Winning new fans! Belting out his chart-topping song Youth with a live backing band, the 20-year-old certainly did Australia proud as he romanced the ears of the show's packed audience
Speaking to the magazine, he admitted his astonishing success has led to people from his school days showing a keener interest in him.
'Definitely people have come out of the woodwork a little bit, but I've only really had about four friends that I am really, really close with,' he said.
'In Perth I feel like I get a little bit of social anxiety. I probably do better with adults than I do with people my age.'
He also spoke about the moment he sat his parents down at the age of 14 and told them he was gay before asking his father if 'he still loved him.'
Out now! Troye's first studio album, Blue Neighbourhood, was released in December 2015
Out of this world! The curly-haired rocker revealed his quirky style as he donned a retro bomber jacket emblazoned with imagery of America's first landing on the moon
'I still can't believe that actually happened': Straight after the performance, Troye tweeted a photo with Ellen show branding to his more than three million followers
And three years later he decided to tell his fans.
Although the decision to come out didn't affect his career progression, he said he was still intimated by boys his own age.
'I never played sport at all and I think that's a mistake because I've just never had those bonds that the other boys had when they were playing footy,' he said.
